DataElement.preferredName: Patient Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Finding Requirements Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating that a patient with the diagnosis of triple-negative breast cancer meets additional requirements for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Finding Requirements Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Triple-negative breast cancer is defined by a lack of expression of estrogen receptor (ER), progesterone receptor (PR), and human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2/neu)._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Finding Clinical Trial Requirement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Triple-negative breast cancer is defined by a lack of expression of estrogen receptor (ER), progesterone receptor (PR), and human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2/neu).:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.:Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Triple-negative breast cancer finding is a negative test result that occurs when the cells in the tumor of a breast cancer patient lack the receptors for both estrogen and progesterone and the human epidermal growth factor receptor 2.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has triple-negativ
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) is patient known germline BRCA wild type, has basaloid subtype TNBC as determined by research PAM-50 test, and has tumor amenable for and is willing to undergo, baseline and on-treatment biopsies (first 20 evaluable patients only)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the expansion cohort, does patient have triple-negative, BRCA-mutant positive OR triple-negative, non-BRCA mutated breast cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have one of the following (For Part 1 and 2):  TNBC (estrogen receptor less than or equal to 1%, progesterone receptor less than or equal to 1%, human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 0–1+ or non-amplified); OR solid tumor with genomic alteration(s) activating RAS signaling including activating KRAS, NRAS, HRAS, or BRAF mutations, inactivating NF1 mutations, or BRAF fusions?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a histologically or cytologically confirmed diagnosis of TNBC based on standard criteria for the disease as defined in the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed TNBC (ER and PR less than or equal to 10%, HER2-negative per ASCO/CAP guidelines) that is metastatic or unresectable?
